title: Pitot-Static and Stall Warning Anti-ice Systems To prevent e…
caption_en: Pitot-Static and Stall Warning Anti-ice Systems To prevent erroneous readings, the following probes are heated :- - left, right and standby pitot-static probes - left and right AOA (angle of attack) vanes and TAT probe.

title: The L PROBES and R PROBES switches are located on the anti-i…
caption_en: The L PROBES and R PROBES switches are located on the anti-ice control panel. These switches control the heating for the probes as shown above.

title: With the switches off, their respective OFF light is illumin…
caption_en: With the switches off, their respective OFF light is illuminated. This is accompanied by the caution CAS messages LR PITOTHT and PITOTHT. Normally, the L and R PROBES switches are selected on for flight.

title: The integral heating elements for right pitot-static probe, …
caption_en: The integral heating elements for right pitot-static probe, AOA vane and TAT probe are powered by the DC R Main Bus. The standby pitot-static probe is powered by the Right Essential Bus. Note that the TAT probe is heated only when airborne.

title: A failure of the respective probe will bring on the caution …
caption_en: A failure of the respective probe will bring on the caution CAS messages as shown above.

title: Both the left AOA vane and the pitot-static probe are powere…
caption_en: Both the left AOA vane and the pitot-static probe are powered by the Left Main Bus.

title: A failure of the respective probe will bring on the caution …
caption_en: A failure of the respective probe will bring on the caution CAS messages as indicated above.
